instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
Hey Guys, 

Working on 820-3476 with severe water damage and corrosion. Replaced all bad components, using original Apple MagSafe 60w green light but no fan spin. 

Here my measures:

PPBUS_G3H : 12.57v
PP3V42_G3H : 3.42v
PPVRTC_G3H : 3.3v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN : 3.398v
PP3V3_SUS : 3.3v
PP3V3_S5 : 3.3v
PP3V3_S4 : 0.452v
PP3V3_S3 : 0.384v
PP3V3_S0 : 2v (not normal)
PP5V_S5 : 5v
PP5V_S4 : 0v
PP5V_S0 : 0v

ALL_SYS_PWRGD : 0v

PCH_SUSACK_L : 3.3v
PM_RSMRST_L : 3.3v
PM_BATLOW_L : 3.3v
PM_DSW_PWRGD : 3.42v
PM_SYSRST_L : 2v (not normal)

PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK : 0v
PM_PCH_PWROK : 0v
PLT_RESET_L : 0v
PM_SLP_S5_L : 0v
S4_PWR_EN : 0v

Replaced U8030, PP3v3_S0 still 2v
Missing S4 rails also.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.
If yes, then check for pulse at all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals, at same time.

Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61623, member: 682"]
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.
[/QUOTE]
Yes, drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L : 3.42v to 0.349v

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61623, member: 682"]
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
[/QUOTE]
How do i try this ?! 

No pulse for PM_SLP_Sx_L signals, still 0v

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
Looks like you have PCH issue.

"How do i try this ?!"
Press power button, connect charger and maintain pressing 5-10s.
Remove battery first.

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
Cleaning area around CPU/PCH, now PM_SLP_S5_L pulsing from 2.472v to 0v for less than a second.

PCH issue ???

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
"Did you try SMC bypass mode?"
???

Did you check for pulse at all big coils?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61662, member: 682"]
"Did you try SMC bypass mode?"
[/QUOTE]
Yes, nothing happen. Fan still not spinning.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61662, member: 682"]
Did you check for pulse at all big coils?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, except for L7310 (12.57v) and L7560 (3.3v) other coils just 0v (not pulsing)

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
"now PM_SLP_S5_L pulsing from 2.472v to 0v"
When it is high, machine must exit from S5 state, going to S3.
Do you get pulse on other PM_SLP_Sx_L signal at same time?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476, water damage, green light, PP3V3_S0 = 2v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 61708, member: 682"]
Do you ger pulse on other PM_SLP_Sx_L signal at same time?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, due to really bad water damage and corrosion it highly PCH issue.

I'll skip this and working another board right now.
Thanks for your help 2informaticos ?
